context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: thoroughly review the sales reports and transactions that day
immediately notify his superior or the owner about the missing money
check the security cameras and any available records of transactions to identify any inconsistencies or mistakes
check the sales records and receipts again to see if there was a mistake in calculations
immediately notify his supervisor or the owner of the business about the discrepancy
check the security cameras if available or investigate if the money was spent on buying something necessary for the bakery, like supplies or ingredients
check the security camera footage to see if a mistake or theft occurred
double check the transactions of the day
immediately investigate the discrepancy
immediately notify his superior or the owner about the missing money

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad should do is to
generation: stay put, especially if they have already informed someone about the location of their hike before they got lost
stay put and create a visible signal for rescuers
stay in one place and create a visible signal, like a distress signal using bright clothing or a smoke fire, that can be seen from the air
stay in one place or create a shelter
stay put in one place and not try to find their way out
stay in one place and avoid roaming around to conserve energy and make it easier for the rescue team to locate them
stay put in a visible and open area
find a way to signal for help
stay in one place
try and find a sheltered area where they can stay warm and be visible for any rescue crews
